intro: Fleischmannia mayorii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are often hairy and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Fleischmannia mayorii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
